title: Tau PET Longitudinal Substudy Associated With: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Parallel-Group Study in Preclinical PSEN1 E280A Mutation Carriers Randomized to Crenezumab or Placebo, and in Non-randomized, Placebo-treated Non-carriers From the Same Kindred, to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Crenezumab in the Treatment of Autosomal-Dominant Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: This substudy will evaluate the effect of crenezumab on the longitudinal tau burden in a subgroup of preclinical Presenilin1 (PSEN1) E280A mutation carriers and non-carriers, who were enrolled in study NCT01998841 (GN28352). Participants will receive up to three intravenous (IV) injections of \[\^18F\] Genentech Tau Probe 1 (GTP1) and will undergo a tau positron emission tomography (PET) scan after each IV injection of \[18\^F\]GTP1. The purpose of this substudy is to increase the understanding of disease progression in the preclinical stage of familial Alzheimer's Disease (AD).

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: This sub-study enrolled participants from the main study: NCT01998841, who consented to participate in it. Participants took part in this sub-study from 10 Jun 2019 to 19 Apr 2022.

groups.title: Crenezumab - Mutation Carriers
groups.description: Participants who were PSEN1 E280A mutation carriers and were administered crenezumab, 720 milligrams (mg), subcutaneously (SC), every two weeks (Q2W), or 60 milligrams per kilograms (mg/kg), intravenously (IV), every four weeks (Q4W) in the main study (NCT01998841) received up to three intravenous (IV) injections of \[\^18F\] Genentech Tau Probe 1 (GTP1) and underwent a tau positron emission tomography (PET) scan after each IV injection of \[\^18F\]GTP1.

groups.title: Placebo - Mutation Carriers
groups.description: Participants who were PSEN1 E280A mutation carriers and were administered crenezumab matching placebo SC, Q2W or IV, Q4W in the main study (NCT01998841) received up to three IV injections of \[\^18F\]GTP1 and underwent a tau PET scan after each IV injection of \[\^18F\]GTP1.

groups.title: Placebo - Non-Carriers of Mutation
groups.description: Participants who were non-carriers of PSEN1 E280A mutation and were administered crenezumab matching placebo SC, Q2W or IV, Q4W in the main study (NCT01998841) received up to three IV injections of \[\^18F\]GTP1 and underwent a tau PET scan after each IV injection of \[\^18F\]GTP1.

dropWithdraws.type: Reason not disclosed to prevent genetic unblinding

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Annualized Rate of Change in Tau Burden
outcomeMeasures.description: Tau is a protein that accumulates in Alzheimer's disease and damages brain cells including those essential for learning and memory. The effect of crenezumab on tau burden was assessed using \[18F\]GTP1 Tau PET. The annualized rate of change in tau burden from the first \[18F\]GTP1 scan of the standardized uptake ratio (SUVR) in the entorhinal cortex (Braak Stage 1) with an inferior cerebellum reference region was analyzed using a random coefficient regression model (RCRM). Braak staging classifies the degree of pathology in Alzheimer's disease. Braak stages 1 and 2 are used when neurofibrillary tangle involvement is confined mainly to the transentorhinal region of the brain, stages 3 and 4 when there is also involvement of limbic regions such as the hippocampus, and 5 and 6 when there is extensive neocortical involvement.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) population included all mutation carrier participants randomized in Study GN28352 (NCT01998841) and consented to the tau PET substudy who had received at least 1 dose of study drug.

groups.title: Crenezumab - Mutation Carriers
groups.description: Participants who were PSEN1 E280A mutation carriers and were administered crenezumab, 720 mg, SC, Q2W, or 60 mg/kg, IV, Q4W in the main study (NCT01998841) received up to three intravenous (IV) injections of \[\^18F\]GTP1 and underwent a tau PET scan after each IV injection of \[\^18F\]GTP1.

groups.title: Placebo - Mutation Carriers
groups.description: Participants who were PSEN1 E280A mutation carriers and were administered crenezumab matching placebo SC, Q2W or IV, Q4W in the main study (NCT01998841) received up to three IV injections of \[\^18F\]GTP1 and underwent a tau PET scan after each IV injection of \[\^18F\]GTP1.

analyses.groupDescription: Analysis was based on RCRM using unstructured covariance matrix: GTP1 PET = Treatment \* Analysis Year + Interactive Voice or Web Response System (IxRS) defined Age Group + IxRS defined Education History + IxRS defined apolipoprotein (APOE4) Carrier Status + IxRS defined Clinical Dementia Rating Global Score.
analyses.paramType: Difference in Annualized Rate of Change

adverseEventsModule.description: Safety population included all participants randomized in Study GN28352 (NCT01998841) and consented to the tau PET substudy who had received at least 1 dose of study drug; participants were grouped according to the actual treatment received and the mutation status. Pooled data has been reported for the SAEs and non-serious AEs in order to maintain blinding of the participant's mutation status and treatment group.

eventGroups.title: Crenezumab - Mutation Carriers
eventGroups.description: Participants who were PSEN1 E280A mutation carriers and were administered crenezumab, 720 mg, SC, Q2W, or 60 mg/kg, IV, Q4W in the main study (NCT01998841) received up to three IV injections of \[\^18F\] GTP1 and underwent a tau PET scan after each IV injection of \[\^18F\]GTP1.

eventGroups.title: Pooled Placebo
eventGroups.description: Carriers and non-carriers of PSEN1 E280A mutation who received matching placebo SC, Q2W or IV, Q4W in the main study (NCT01998841), received up to three IV injections of \[\^18F\]GTP1 and underwent a tau PET scan after each IV injection of \[\^18F\]GTP1.

eventGroups.title: Combined Blinded
eventGroups.description: All participants who were carriers and non-carriers of PSEN1 E280A mutation and who received either crenezumab, 720 mg, SC, Q2W, or 60 mg/kg, IV, Q4W or matching placebo SC, Q2W or IV, Q4W in the main study (NCT01998841) received up to three IV injections of \[\^18F\]GTP1 and underwent a tau PET scan after each IV injection of \[\^18F\]GTP1.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.

explanation_target: Reason: The intervention in the described substudy is crenezumab, which is a humanized monoclonal antibody developed to bind and neutralize amyloid-β species (preferentially oligomers) — i.e., a biologic that targets Alzheimer’s pathology, consistent with a disease-modifying intent rather than a symptomatic cognitive enhancer or neuropsychiatric treatment. citeturn0search4turn1search0

Act: Key extracted details from the trial description — drug = crenezumab (monoclonal antibody vs placebo); longitudinal tau burden is being measured with Genentech Tau Probe 1 ([18F]GTP1) PET scans. [18F]GTP1 is a Genentech-developed tau PET tracer for imaging neurofibrillary (tau) pathology. The parent trial is the API ADAD (NCT01998841) crenezumab vs placebo study in PSEN1 E280A carriers. citeturn0search1turn1search1

Reflect: Classification check — crenezumab is a biologic targeting an Alzheimer's disease hallmark (amyloid-β), so the correct category is 'disease-targeted biologic'. The substudy’s use of tau PET is a biomarker/endpoint to assess disease progression, but the therapeutic agent remains a biologic targeting pathology, not a small molecule, symptomatic cognitive enhancer, or neuropsychiatric treatment. No substantial ambiguity in categorization based on available information. (Additional context: crenezumab development and its role in the API trial are documented by Genentech/Roche and the NIA/API publications.) citeturn0search5turn1search7
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational agent is crenezumab, a humanized monoclonal antibody developed to bind and neutralize beta‑amyloid species (with preferential binding to oligomeric Aβ), i.e., the intervention targets amyloid pathology. The substudy’s use of [18F]GTP1 tau PET is a biomarker/endpoint to measure tau burden, not the therapeutic target. citeturn0search5turn0search6turn0search3

Act: Extracted details from the description — drug = crenezumab (anti‑Aβ monoclonal antibody; IgG4 backbone designed to reduce inflammatory responses and reported to preferentially bind Aβ oligomers), parent trial = API ADAD PSEN1 E280A randomized crenezumab vs placebo study (NCT01998841), substudy outcome = longitudinal tau burden measured with Genentech Tau Probe 1 ([18F]GTP1) PET. These facts support that the therapeutic target is amyloid‑beta while tau PET is an imaging endpoint. citeturn0search5turn0search0turn0search1turn0search3

Reflect: Classification check — crenezumab’s mechanism (anti‑Aβ immunotherapy, oligomer preference) maps directly to CADRO category A) Amyloid beta. The presence of a tau PET substudy does not change the drug’s target classification because it is a biomarker used to assess disease progression rather than the intervention’s biological target. No evidence in the description that the drug primarily targets tau, inflammation, or other pathways; therefore the correct CADRO assignment is A) Amyloid beta. citeturn0search6turn0search3

Web search results (key sources used): 1) Genentech press release / program description summarizing crenezumab as an anti‑amyloid (oligomer‑preferring) IgG4 monoclonal antibody. citeturn0search5 2) Publication and descriptions of the API ADAD (PSEN1 E280A) crenezumab randomized study (trial methods and context). citeturn0search0 3) Publications describing [18F]GTP1 (Genentech Tau Probe 1) as a tau PET tracer used to image neurofibrillary tau pathology (used in longitudinal studies). citeturn0search1turn0search3 4) Mechanistic/structural work and conference abstracts showing crenezumab’s preferential binding to Aβ oligomers. citeturn0search6turn0search7
